article.headline: Dow jumps nearly 100 points on gains in shares of IBM, Cisco
article.body: Shares of IBM and Cisco are seeing positive momentum Thursday morning, propelling the Dow Jones Industrial Average into positive territory. The Dow DJIA, +0.56% is trading 98 points higher (0.3%), as shares of IBM IBM, -2.81% and Cisco CSCO, +0.15% are contributing around a quarter of the index's intraday rally. IBM's shares have risen $9.41, or 7.6%, while those of Cisco have risen $0.74, or 1.9%, combining for a roughly 67-point boost for the Dow. American Express AXP, +0.26%, Chevron CVX, -1.62%, and Travelers TRV, +0.18% are also contributing significantly to the gain. A $1 move in any of the index's 30 components equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
